bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Pedro Nogueira, January 14, 1954

div1.p: Hench writes Nogueira to make sure that Truby receives his Finlay Medal and to inquire about microfilming Finlay's diaries during his upcoming visit to Cuba.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Pedro Nogueira, January 14, 1954
div1.opener:
January 14, 1954
Dr. Pedro Nogueira
Marti 219, Marianao
Habana, Cuba
My dear Pedro:
div1.p:
It is a curious thing that when you are writing
me, I am writing you. It is interesting to note
that at the very time you are thinking and planning
for the dissemination of the Finlay Medals,
General Truby should be wondering about his. I
send you a letter that I have just received from
him. I think you are already taking care of
this and it will be my pleasure to assure him
of that.

I think I sent you a copy of my letter to Doctor
Presno with regard to Surgeon General Armstrong's
request for a microfilm of the Finlay diaries.
I do hope that we can accomplish this when I come
to Havana. Remember I want to get you a copy
also.
div1.closer:
Always sincerely, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
